cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 30 mi SSE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to meander near the Yucatan Channel today, then accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf of Mexico and cross the Florida Big Bend before moving across southern Georgia toward the Atlantic coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend (near Cedar Key – Apalachee Bay area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline at this time
weather_observation.warning_coast: None issued for U.S. coastline at this time
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida west coast, Florida Panhandle, southern Georgia, South Carolina and North Carolina coasts
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Likely (3–6 inches forecast with isolated 10 inches)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Uncertain – currently below threshold but may rise if track shifts closer
weather_observation.wind: Up to a 22% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (>=34 kt) late Wed–Thu with gusty conditions possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible if onshore flow develops; current guidance does not exceed 3 ft for GA coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rain bands could drop 3–6 inches with localized amounts above 4 inches, producing flash/urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; brief port-side squalls reducing visibility and affecting crane operations
